intro: Leucosyris parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered leucosyris, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia, including China and Japan. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and traditional herbal practices.
